alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 3:10AM PST until January 11 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM WEDNESDAY TO 1 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches for Lake Tahoe communities such as Truckee and South Lake Tahoe, and 12 to 24 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph in lower elevations and 80 to 100 mph along Sierra ridges. Wave heights on Lake Tahoe 2 to 5 feet. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 4 AM Wednesday to 1 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. Very cold temperatures settling in Wednesday night may prolong travel issues into Thursday morning. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, carry chains, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Be prepared for long travel delays or adjust your travel plans to avoid periods of heavy snow and white out conditions. The latest road conditions can be found by checking with CalTrans in California and NDOT in Nevada.
